      • valueOf

        public static Alignment valueOf(char cChar)
        Returns the alignment instance that is identified by a certain character. The character must be the first letter of the instance name.
        Parameters:
        cChar - The alignment character (case-sensitive)
        Returns:
        The matching alignment instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the character doesn't represent an alignment instance

      • calcAlignedPosition

        public abstract int calcAlignedPosition(int nStart,
                                        int nFreeSpace,
                                        boolean bLeftToRight)
        Calculates and returns a coordinate aligned according to this alignment based on the starting position and the remaining free space of the area to align in.
        Parameters:
        nStart - The starting coordinate of the area to align in
        nFreeSpace - The free space available for alignment
        bLeftToRight - TRUE for left-to-right display
        Returns:
        The calculated aligned coordinate

      • calcAlignedPosition

        public int calcAlignedPosition(int nStart,
                               int nFullSize,
                               int nAlignSize)
        Calculates and returns a coordinate aligned according to this alignment based on the starting position, the size of the element to align, and the full size of the are to align the element in.
        Parameters:
        nStart - The starting coordinate of the area to align in
        nFullSize - The full size (i.e. width or height) of the area
        nAlignSize - The size of the element to align
        Returns:
        The calculated aligned coordinate

      • getCharacter

        public final char getCharacter()
        Returns the character representation of this instance.
        Returns:
        The character describing this instance

      • getCssName

        public java.lang.String getCssName()
        Returns the CSS name of this alignment. This is the standard name that is used in modern CSS mechanisms like grid layout for alignment and justification.
        Specified by:
        getCssName in interface HasCssName
        Returns:
        The CSS name
